text: وتلك نعمة تمنها على ان عبدت بنى اسرءيل

translations.translation: And anyway you can only reproach me with this favour because you made the tribe of Israel into slaves!'
But the favour you oblige me with is that you have enslaved the children of Israel."
Now this is the favour that you tauntingly remind me of: that you enslaved the Children of Israel!"
And this is the favor with which you oblige me: You have made the Israelites your slaves.
“And is this some great reward for which you express favour upon me – that you have enslaved the Descendants of Israel?”
And this is the past favor with which you reproach me, -- that you have enslaved the Children of Israel."
And is it a favor of which you remind me that you have enslaved the children of Israel?
That is a blessing thou reproachest me with, having enslaved the Children of Israel.'
And this is the past favour wherewith thou reproachest me: that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel.
And this is the favour with which you taunt me -- that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
And that favour wherewith thou didst oblige me was that thou hadst enslaved the Children of Isra'il?
That you have enslaved the Children of Israel—is that the favour with which you reproach me?’
And this is the favour with which thou dost reproach me,- that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel!"
And this is the past favour with which you reproach me, that you have enslaved the Children of Israel."
Is this then the blessing with which you reproach me, that you have the Children of Israel for worshipers'
Is that the favor you taunt me with, although you have enslaved the Children of Israel?”
And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"

[26:22] That is a favour with which you now reproach me that you have enslaved the Children of Israel’ (an ‘abbadta banī Isrā’īl, is explicative of tilka, ‘that’) in other words, you have enslaved them but not me: there is no favour in that, for your enslavement of them is wrong (some [scholars] have reckoned there to be an interrogative hamza of denial at the beginning of this verse [a-tilka ni‘matun, ‘is that a favour?’]).
(And this is the past favour wherewith) with which (thou reproachest me) Pharaoh, but you do not recall your aloofness towards me: (that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel. 407

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { عَبَّدتَّ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ } معناه اتَّخذتَهُمْ عَبِيداً وقَهرتَهُمْ

translations.translation: And His saying, "I have taken the children of Israel as My servants" - this means that You have taken them as Your slaves and have subdued them.
